page.title: 08Standon May Day (cont)
page.content:
by the May Queen and her attendants, from a local school, various Morris Dance teams proceed down the High Street to the village greens where an arena has been made across the road. The street is lined with craft stalls of all descriptions and the village decorated to suit the occasion.
In the arena the May Queen is crowned and children dance round the Maypole which is in the centre of the road. For the rest of the afternoon there is a wide range of folk dancing from the children and the dance teams of Cotswold Morris,Rapper Sword N.W. Clog Morris and Clog step dancing.
Whilst this is going on there are other activities in Burr's Meadow such as bowling for the pig and in the Church there are art displays by
